News_Title: BYD (SEHK:1211) Valuation Check As P/E Premium Contrasts With Cash Flow Upside Signals
News_Content:
Hong Kong
/Auto
/SEHK:1211
BYD (SEHK:1211) Valuation Check As P/E Premium Contrasts With Cash Flow Upside Signals
Simply Wall St
January 28, 2026
Recent share performance and business scale
Without a clear single news catalyst, you might be looking at BYD (SEHK:1211) simply because its recent share performance and business size stand out among Hong Kong listed auto and battery groups.
Over the past month, BYD shares have returned about 5.9%, while the past 3 months show a modest 1.3% decline. On a 1 year view, the total return figure provided is 14.2%.
The company reports revenue of CN¬•841.1b and net income of CN¬•38.3b. This reflects a large-scale operation across automobiles, batteries and related services. Annual revenue growth is given as 10.8%, with net income growth at 16.3%.
At the last close of HK$102.80, some valuation metrics in the data suggest a potential gap between market price and certain fair value estimates. However, these approaches depend heavily on the assumptions behind each model.
See our latest analysis for BYD.
Recent trading points to rebuilding momentum, with a 1 day share price return of 4.6% and a 7 day share price return of 3.8%, set against a 1 year total shareholder return of 14.2% that reflects steadier long term gains.
If BYD has you thinking more broadly about the auto space, it could be a good time to see what else is on the move among auto manufacturers.
So with BYD trading at HK$102.80 alongside fair value and price target estimates that sit higher, is the current share price a genuine gap you can exploit, or is the market already factoring in future growth?
Price to earnings of 21.7x: Is it justified?
On the latest numbers, BYD trades on a P/E of 21.7x, while our fair value work points to a lower P/E of 13.8x and the shares sit below some cash flow based estimates such as the SWS DCF model fair value of HK$136 versus the last close at HK$102.80.
The P/E ratio compares the current share price with earnings per share and is a common way for investors to judge how much they are paying for each unit of profit. For a large auto and battery group like BYD, a higher P/E can reflect expectations for further earnings progress as well as the breadth of its businesses across vehicles, batteries and related services.
Here, the 21.7x P/E sits above both the Asian auto industry average of 18.2x and a peer average of 8.3x. This suggests the market is assigning BYD a richer earnings tag than many regional and peer names. Compared with the estimated fair P/E of 13.8x, the gap is also wide. This highlights a level that the market could move towards if sentiment or earnings expectations change.
Explore the SWS fair ratio for BYD
Result: Price to earnings of 21.7x (OVERVALUED)
However, you still need to watch for earnings expectations resetting if sentiment toward higher P/E auto names cools or if analyst price targets are revised lower.
Find out about the key risks to this BYD narrative.
Another view: Cash flow says something different
If you put the earnings multiple to one side and look at our SWS DCF model, you get a different message. On this view, BYD at HK$102.80 sits about 24.4% below an estimated fair value of HK$136, which points to potential upside rather than stretch.
That gap matters because it shows how sensitive conclusions can be to the tool you use, and to the assumptions built into it. If profits or cash flows play out differently, could this apparent cushion shrink or widen from here?
Look into how the SWS DCF model arrives at its fair value.
1211 Discounted Cash Flow as at Jan 2026
Simply Wall St performs a discounted cash flow (DCF) on every stock in the world every day (check out BYD for example). We show the entire calculation in full. You can track the result in your watchlist or portfolio and be alerted when this changes, or use our stock screener to discover 876 undervalued stocks based on their cash flows. If you save a screener we even alert you when new companies match - so you never miss a potential opportunity.
Build Your Own BYD Narrative
If this view does not quite match your own read of the numbers, you can test the assumptions yourself and shape a personalised thesis in just a few minutes with Do it your way.

News_Title: TENCENT STOCK SLIPS INTO WEEKEND AS 0700.HK LAGS TECH GAUGE ‚Äî WHAT TO WATCH BEFORE MONDAY
News_Content:
24 JANUARY 2026
HKG:0700.HK¬∑INVESTING¬∑MARKET ANALYSIS¬∑STOCK MARKET¬∑TECHNOLOGY
1 MIN READ
TENCENT STOCK SLIPS INTO WEEKEND AS 0700.HK LAGS TECH GAUGE ‚Äî WHAT TO WATCH BEFORE MONDAY
BY KHADIJA SAEED
HONG KONG, Jan 24, 2026, 23:10 HKT ‚Äî Market closed.
Tencent slipped 0.4% to close at HK$595 on Friday, lagging behind the Hang Seng Tech index‚Äôs rise.
Attention shifts to the Fed‚Äôs decision next week and crucial activity data out of China.
Tencent is gearing up for its annual results briefing, set for mid-March.
Tencent Holdings Ltd shares dipped on Friday, pushing the Hong Kong-listed tech giant into the new week under pressure, even as the broader sector showed strength. (Yahoo Finance)
That‚Äôs crucial since global tech sentiment has been carrying much of the market‚Äôs weight lately. The coming days will put that to the test, with U.S. rate signals on deck and a crowded calendar of major tech earnings that could ripple into Asia. (Reuters)
Hong Kong markets remain closed Saturday. They reopen Monday.
Tencent ended Friday at HK$595, fluctuating between HK$595 and HK$602 during the session, with roughly 19.2 million shares traded, according to data. (Yahoo Finance)
The Hang Seng TECH Index climbed 0.6% today, keeping Chinese internet stocks under the spotlight as investors selectively bought in. (Investing)
Rate expectations linger quietly. The Federal Reserve‚Äôs upcoming policy meeting is set for Jan. 27-28, with investors watching closely for any shifts in tone from Chair Jerome Powell. (Federal Reserve)
Tencent, famous for WeChat and its vast gaming and advertising operations, is betting on artificial intelligence to fuel growth, boosting investments in computing power along the way.
Tencent president Martin Lau flagged chip shortages as a key bottleneck during a November earnings call, saying AI chip scarcity is capping cloud growth. He added that if supply weren‚Äôt an issue, ‚Äúour cloud revenue should be growing more.‚Äù (Reuters)
China‚Äôs official manufacturing PMI is set for release on Jan. 31. Investors watch this figure closely as a snapshot of factory output and the broader domestic economy. (FXStreet)
The risk scenario is clear: weak China data, a fresh jump in global yields, or stricter restrictions on advanced chips could reignite selling in China tech stocks, which are already pricey. A stumble in ad spending or delays in game releases would only deepen the pressure.
Tencent is set to release its 2025 fourth-quarter and full-year results on March 18, as listed in its investor calendar. (Tencent)
Traders are zeroing in on the Fed‚Äôs Jan. 28 decision and Powell‚Äôs press conference ‚Äî an event that could shift risk appetite far beyond just Wall Street.
KHADIJA SAEED
LATEST POSTS
A dedicated markets reporter, she covers stocks, macroeconomics, and major business developments with a sharp eye for detail and accuracy.
STOCK MARKET TODAY
Simplex Holdings (TSE:4373) Seen Trading Below Fair Value Despite Premium P/E
February 1, 2026, 9:59 AM EST. Simplex Holdings (TSE:4373) reported strong revenue and profit growth for the nine months ending December 31, 2025. The company implemented a four-for-one stock split and launched a significant share buyback program. Its price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio stands at 20.7x, above the peer average but below its own fair P/E of 24.6x, implying some upside potential. Earnings growth has outpaced the industry with a 56.6% increase over the past year and raised guidance for the future. However, recent short-term stock price gains have slowed, with 30- and 90-day returns of 8.75% and 10.79%, respectively. The market appears to price in robust growth, but questions remain about risks to revenue and net income growth. Investors should watch how Simplex compares with tech and AI peers in Japan's IT sector.

News_Title: Is Tencent Holdings (SEHK:700) Offering Value After Its 64% One Year Share Price Gain
News_Content:
Is Tencent Holdings (SEHK:700) Offering Value After Its 64% One Year Share Price Gain
Simply Wall St
January 18, 2026 6 min read
In this article:
TCEHY
-1.94%
TCTZF
+2.09%
Track your investments for FREE with Simply Wall St, the portfolio command center trusted by over 7 million individual investors worldwide.
If you are wondering whether Tencent Holdings is still offering value at its current price, this article will walk you through what the numbers are really saying about the stock.
The shares last closed at HK$617.5, with returns of 1.1% over 7 days, 2.1% over 30 days, a 0.9% decline year to date, and 64.0% over the past year, plus 61.5% over 3 years and 0.1% over 5 years.
Recent coverage has focused on Tencent's role as a major Hong Kong listed media and technology name and how sentiment toward large China exposed platforms has shifted over time. This context helps frame why investors are paying close attention to Tencent's share price moves and what they might mean for risk and opportunity.
On our checks, Tencent scores a 5 out of 6 valuation score. This suggests it screens as undervalued on most of the methods we use. Next we will break down those approaches and then finish with a way to think about valuation that goes beyond the usual ratios.
Find out why Tencent Holdings's 64.0% return over the last year is lagging behind its peers.
Approach 1: Tencent Holdings Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) Analysis
A Discounted Cash Flow model takes the cash Tencent Holdings is expected to generate in the future, then discounts those amounts back to what they are worth today to estimate an intrinsic value per share.
On this approach, Tencent starts from last twelve month free cash flow of about CN¬•201.2b. Analysts provide forecasts for several years, and Simply Wall St then extends those estimates further. By 2029, projected free cash flow is CN¬•403.7b, with intermediate years such as 2026 and 2027 sitting in the CN¬•258.7b to CN¬•310.1b range. Later years gradually increase toward the mid CN¬•500b level by 2035 based on extrapolated assumptions.
When all these projected cash flows are discounted back and combined using a 2 Stage Free Cash Flow to Equity model, the resulting intrinsic value comes out at HK$897.25 per share. Against the recent share price of HK$617.50, this implies the stock screens as around 31.2% undervalued on this method.
Result: UNDERVALUED
Our Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests Tencent Holdings is undervalued by 31.2%. Track this in your watchlist or portfolio, or discover 872 more undervalued stocks based on cash flows.
700 Discounted Cash Flow as at Jan 2026
Head to the Valuation section of our Company Report for more details on how we arrive at this Fair Value for Tencent Holdings.
Approach 2: Tencent Holdings Price vs Earnings
For a profitable company like Tencent, the P/E ratio is a straightforward way to see what investors are paying for each unit of current earnings. It helps you compare the share price with the earnings that are already in place, without getting lost in more complex models.

News_Title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq rise for second day in a row as Greenland drama fades
News_Content:
Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq rise for second day in a row as Greenland drama fades
Rian Howlett
and
Karen Friar
Updated January 23, 2026 2 min read
In this article:
StockStory Top Pick
GE
+2.69%
META
-2.95%
^DJI
-0.36%
^IXIC
-0.94%
^GSPC
-0.43%
US stocks rose on Thursday as investors breathed a continued sigh of relief that President Trump called off his threatened tariffs on European allies over his pursuit of Greenland.
The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) led the advance, rising nearly 0.9% as Tesla (TSLA) shares surged over robotaxi optimism. The blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) gained roughly 0.6%. Meanwhile, the benchmark S&P 500 (^GSPC) added 0.5% on the heels of Wall Street's sharp rally on Wednesday.
Gold (GC=F) also crossed $4,900 per ounce for the first time on Thursday, extending a string of record highs since the start of the year.
Nasdaq GIDS - Delayed Quote
‚Ä¢
USD
NASDAQ Composite (^IXIC)
Follow
View Quote Details
23,461.82
-223.30
(-0.94%)
At close: January 30 at 5:15:59 PM EST
^IXIC
^DJI
^GSPC
Advanced Chart
Stocks continued climbing after Trump hit pause on the 10% tariffs planned for eight NATO members in February, soothing the concerns that weighed on Wall Street earlier in the week. But investors remain on alert, as the EU and the US are still at odds over who will control Greenland.
Trump said he had drawn up a "framework of a future deal" with NATO's leader for the Arctic island, which the US wants to purchase. But Denmark's prime minister stressed Thursday that the sovereignty of its territory is not up for discussion.
Beyond trade and geopolitics, investors are bracing for Intel (INTC) to lead out Big Tech earnings when it reports quarterly results after the bell on Thursday. AI spending by the likes of Meta (META) and a global memory shortage will be in focus as the chipmaker attempts a turnaround. Procter & Gamble (PG) and GE Aerospace (GE) are among the crowd of companies also on the earnings docket.
Read more: Live coverage of corporate earnings
Meanwhile, a shutdown-delayed report on the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge, the PCE price index, showed that consumer prices rose at a 2.8% annual pace in November. That inflation data, coupled with initial jobless claims, which increased only marginally, kept the Fed on course to hold rates steady at its next policy meeting.
In another economic reading, the US economy grew at the fastest pace in two years through the third quarter of 2025. GDP grew at an annual pace of 4.4% for the quarter in an upgrade from the government's first estimate.
Even so, unemployment benefits claims ticked up to 200,000 for the week ended Jan. 17, up just slightly from the previous week's 199,000 filings, according to Labor Department data.
LIVE COVERAGE IS OVER 22 updates
Fri, January 23, 2026 at 5:05 AM GMT+8
Ines Ferr√©
Stocks rise for second day in a row, gold crosses $4,900
Stocks rose for a second day in a row as the threat of an escalation over President Trump's pursuit of Greenland faded.
The S&P 500 (^GSPC) gained 0.5%, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) increased 0.6%.
Tesla (TSLA) shares took the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) higher after CEO Elon Musk said the company started robotaxi rides with no safety monitor present in Austin, a long-awaited move.
The move higher in stocks comes a day after President Trump announced a "framework" for a future deal for Greenland, and abandoned the threat of fresh tariffs against European nations.
Gold (GC=F) touched a fresh record high, surpassing $4,900 for the first time and extending momentum in the precious metals trade.

Musk also claimed on Thursday that he expects the company‚Äôs self driving service to get EU and China approval soon.
Tesla stock popped on the news in midday trade, up over 3%.
